name: Post Malone
description:
'''Austin Richard Post''' (born July 4, 1995), known professionally as '''Post Malone''', is an American singer, rapper, songwriter, musician, record producer, and actor. His music blends various genres including [[Pop music|pop]], [[hip-hop]], [[Trap music|trap]], [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], and [[Country music|country]]. 

Malone began his musical career in 2011, and earned mainstream recognition with his 2015 [[cloud rap]] debut single, "[[White Iverson]]". The song led him to sign with [[Republic Records]], and served as lead single for his debut studio album, ''[[Stoney (album)|Stoney]]'' (2016), which spawned the [[RIAA certification|Diamond]]-certified single "[[Congratulations (Post Malone song)|Congratulations]]" (featuring [[Quavo]]). His second album, ''[[Beerbongs & Bentleys]]'' (2018), debuted atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and set numerous [[Streaming media|streaming]] records. It contained the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] number-one singles "[[Rockstar (Post Malone song)|Rockstar]]" (featuring [[21 Savage]]) and "[[Psycho (Post Malone song)|Psycho]]" (featuring [[Ty Dolla Sign]]), and was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|Album of the Year]] at the [[61st Annual Grammy Awards|61st Grammy Awards]]. His third Hot 100 number-one single, "[[Sunflower (Post Malone and Swae Lee song)|Sunflower]]", a duet with [[Swae Lee]], was released for [[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (soundtrack)|the accompanying soundtrack]] to the 2018 animated film ''[[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse]]''; it became the highest-certified song in [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]] history and was the first to receive a 2Ã— Diamond certification. 

Malone's third album, ''[[Hollywood's Bleeding]]'' (2019), became his second album to receive a nomination for Album of the Year at the [[63rd Annual Grammy Awards|63rd Grammy Awards]]. It spawned the single "[[Circles (Post Malone song)|Circles]]", which spent 61 weeks on the Hot 100, becoming Malone's biggest hit single to date. Malone released his fourth and fifth albums, ''[[Twelve Carat Toothache]]'' (2022) and [[Austin (album)|''Austin'']] (2023), before achieving further number-one hits with guest appearances on [[Taylor Swift]]'s "[[Fortnight (song)|Fortnight]]" and his first [[country pop]] song "[[I Had Some Help]]" with the country singer [[Morgan Wallen]]. The latter served as the lead single of Malone's country sixth album, ''[[F-1 Trillion]]'' (2024), which became his third number-one album on the ''Billboard'' 200.

Malone is among the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists]], with over 150 million records sold in the US alone according to the [[RIAA]]. His [[List of awards and nominations received by Post Malone|accolades]] include eleven [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], five [[American Music Awards]], six [[MTV Video Music Awards]], and eighteen [[Grammy Award]] nominations. He holds several ''Billboard'' chart records: He is the first solo lead artist to top both the [[Rap Airplay]] and [[Adult Contemporary (chart)|Adult Contemporary]] charts, while "[[Circles (Post Malone song)|Circles]]" set the record for longest climb to number one (41 weeks) on the [[Adult Contemporary (chart)|Adult Contemporary chart]] by a solo artist. {{As of|2025}}, Malone holds the record for the artist with the most diamond-certified songs, with nine to his name.
